desc: A mathematical method for finding the derivative of a function.
A concept in quantum mechanics that suggests particles can exhibit both wave-like and particle-like behavior.
A mathematical equation that describes the time evolution of a quantum system.
A mathematical function that describes the wave-like behavior of a quantum system.
A parameter in the Schrödinger Equation that represents the probability of finding a particle in a particular state.
A fundamental principle in quantum mechanics that states that certain pairs of properties, such as position and momentum, cannot be precisely known at the same time.
A phenomenon in which the wave-like behavior of a quantum system results in constructive or destructive interference patterns.
A concept in quantum mechanics that suggests that a quantum system can exist in multiple states simultaneously.
A phenomenon in which the properties of two or more quantum systems become intertwined in such a way that the state of one system cannot be described independently of the others.
